bibl.title: Military Orders for Walter Reed, November 17, 1891

div1.p: Mason requests that Reed be appointed to the examining board at Fort Snelling. The letter, endorsement, and approval are dated from November 17, 1891 to November 23, 1891. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Walter Reed, November 17, 1891
div1.p:
Edwin C. Mason.
Col. 23d Infantry
Passdr Exam.g Board.

Requests that Capt. W.
Reed, Asst. Surg. on duty
at this post, be placed
on duty with Examg
board convened by par.
21. S.O. 251, A.G.O., cs in
place of Capt. Edgar A.
Mearns, Asst. Surg. member
of the board, who is now
on one month's hunting
leave, and is also under
order to change station.

ADJUTANT GENL'S OFFICE,
RECEIVED
NOV 21 1891
--------
A. C. P. DIVISION

Approved: By order of
the Acting Secretary of War.

div1.head: Letter from Edwin C. Mason to the Adjutant General, November 17, 1891
div1.opener:
Fort Snelling, Minn.
November 17th 1891.
The Adjutant General
U.S. Army.
Washington, D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to inform you that Captain Edgar
A. Mearns, Assistant Surgeon, is now on hunting leave for one
month, and the Board appointed by paragraph 21 Special
Order No. 251 c.s. Headquarters of the Army, A.G.O. is awaiting
his return. As Captain Mearns is under orders to change stations,
and Captain Walter Reed, Assistant Surgeon, is now on duty at
this post, I request that the latter officer be substituted for the
former as a member of this Board.
div1.closer:
Very Respectfully,
Your Obedient Servant. Edwin C. Mason Colonel 3d. Infantry.
President of the Board.
491/1891

div1.head: Special Orders, No. 273, November 23, 1891
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS OF THE ARMY,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, November 23, 1891.

3. By direction of the acting Secretary of War Captain Walter
Reed, assistant surgeon, is detailed as a member of the examining
board convened at Fort Snelling, Minnesota, by paragraph 21 of
Special Orders, No. 251, October 28, 1891, from this office, vice Cap-
tain Edgar A. Mearns, assistant surgeon, hereby relieved.

BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL SCHOFIELD:
J. C. KELTON,
Adjutant General.
